verses.kjv: A GOOD name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favour rather than silver and gold.
verses.ct: A good reputation is worth more than enormous wealth, and being well-respected matters more than silver and gold.

verses.kjv: The rich and poor meet together: the LORD is the maker of them all.
verses.ct: Rich and poor have this in common: the LORD made every one of them.

verses.kjv: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.
verses.ct: A sensible person sees danger coming and takes cover, but the naive keep going and pay the price.

verses.kjv: By humility and the fear of the LORD are riches, and honour, and life.
verses.ct: Humility and wholehearted dedication to the LORD bring wealth, honor, and life.

verses.kjv: Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.
verses.ct: The path of the corrupt is full of thorns and traps; anyone who guards their soul will stay far from them.

verses.kjv: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.
verses.ct: Teach a child the right way to live, and even in old age they won't abandon it.

verses.kjv: The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.
verses.ct: The wealthy have power over the poor, and the borrower becomes a slave to the lender.

verses.kjv: He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.
verses.ct: Whoever plants injustice will harvest emptiness, and the power behind their rage will come to nothing.

verses.kjv: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.
verses.ct: Generous people will be blessed, because they share their food with the poor.

verses.kjv: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.
verses.ct: Get rid of the mocker, and conflict goes with them — arguments and insults will stop.

verses.kjv: He that loveth pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.
verses.ct: Whoever loves a pure heart and speaks with grace will have the king as a friend.

verses.kjv: The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.
verses.ct: The LORD watches over knowledge, but he tears apart the schemes of those who betray trust.

verses.kjv: The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.
verses.ct: The lazy person says, 'There's a lion outside! I'll be killed if I go into the streets!'

verses.kjv: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein.
verses.ct: The seductive words of an immoral woman are a deep trap; whoever the LORD has turned against will fall into it.

verses.kjv: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
verses.ct: Foolishness is deeply rooted in a child's heart, but firm discipline will drive it out.

verses.kjv: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.
verses.ct: Exploiting the poor to get richer, or giving gifts to the wealthy — both lead to poverty.

verses.kjv: Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.
verses.ct: Pay close attention and listen to the words of the wise; take my teachings to heart.

verses.kjv: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.
verses.ct: It will be a delight when you store them inside you; keep them ready on your lips.

verses.kjv: That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.
verses.ct: I'm making these things known to you today — yes, specifically to you — so that your trust will be in the LORD.

verses.kjv: Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,
verses.ct: Haven't I written out 30 sayings for you, full of advice and knowledge,

verses.kjv: That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?
verses.ct: so you can recognize what is genuinely true, and give reliable answers to those who sent you?

verses.kjv: Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:
verses.ct: Don't rob the poor just because they're vulnerable, and don't crush the oppressed in court,

verses.kjv: For the LORD will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.
verses.ct: because the LORD will take up their case and will take the life of those who rob them.

verses.kjv: Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:
verses.ct: Don't become friends with someone who has a hot temper, and don't spend time with someone prone to rage,

verses.kjv: Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.
verses.ct: or you'll pick up their habits and trap your own soul.

verses.kjv: Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.
verses.ct: Don't be someone who makes handshake deals or pledges to guarantee other people's debts.

verses.kjv: If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?
verses.ct: If you can't pay up, why risk having your own bed taken right out from under you?

verses.kjv: Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.
verses.ct: Don't move an ancient boundary marker that your ancestors put in place.

verses.kjv: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.
verses.ct: Do you see someone who excels at their work? They will serve before kings — they won't end up working for nobodies.
